body.p:
Munfordville Hart County Ky
12 Novr. 1865
Govr. Bramlett

We the undersigned would represent that on the 6th day of Novr. 1865 in the county of Hart One Ben Johnson killed killed and murdered shot at and wounded samuel Mansfield of which wounds he has since died Now we would represent that in our opinion from the facts as represented to us that said shooting & killing was wilful and deliberate murder and the said Ben Johnson having ^immediately^ fled we would represent that a suitable reward be offered for his apprehension -- had we he is likely to have gone to the states of Tennessee ^Illinois or Missouri^ & we request that you demand his delivery & appoint for his apprehension

Jno Donan
William Gardner Judge of Hart County Court
J. A. Waldock Clerk Hart County Court
C. J. Walton
J C Rush
G. T. Wood
H D Jetts
Ben F Amos

Description Ben Johnson about 30 or 35 years old about 6 feet high weighs about 150 lb sandy or light complexion & beard is a man of family was raised in or near Gainsboro Tenn eyes bylue or Grey scar in one hand was a saddler by trade at one time & freckled face

Reward $250
Hart Co
for Ben Johnson murderer of Saml Mansfield offered
15 Nov/65
Please Appoint Wash Mansfield as agent to catch him
